page.title: 18THE OPENCAST SITE (ONE)
page.content: They started mining in 1981 and it is a ten year project, so it is due to be finished in 1991. 16000 tonnes of coal is produced a week and is taken to Bennerley. One of the trucks on the opencast site is the biggest in the country.The truck picks up 50 tonnes of coal every time and weighs 100 tonnes. The trucks cannot work in the rain because the wheels are made of rubber and they soak up the rain. The opencast has a lot of regulations and the most important ones are safety regulations. On the opencast site they have got 70 trucks. When the trucks have finished their jobs they are dismantled and taken to a different site. When we went to the opencast site we met Mr.Walker who is the coalboard representative. He was a civil engineer and he progressed to get the job at the opencast.
